title: Cardio DOPS - Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting
description: Direct Observation of Procedural Skills (Surgical DOPS)

pages.name: Cardio DOPS - Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Procedure details - Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

elements.name: panel2

rows.text: Demonstrates sound knowledge of indications and contraindications including alternatives to surgery. Clearly explains to patient/relatives the procedure and likely outcomes including possible complications
Understands the anatomy of the coronary arterial tree and can clearly identify the areas of significant narrowing and appropriate grafting targets
Can provide a logical rationale for his/her surgical approach including choice of conduit – after checking what conduits are available for use
Clearly communicates to all staff any particular needs/requirements for the procedure
Ensures “time out” is performed, all necessary equipment is available, and proper positioning of the patient
Achieves good exposure through knowledge of optimum skin incision/portal/access and tissue dissection
CPB safely instituted by appropriate choice of cannulas and cannulation sites, with safe cannulation technique

rows.value: Procedure is performed in a logical sequence Procedure performed in a logical sequence with good surgical technique, communicating well with the rest of the team
rows.text: Procedure performed in a logical sequence with good surgical technique, communicating well with the rest of the team

rows.value: with good surgical technique and good team communication
rows.text: Demonstrates good anastomatic technique, ensures grafts are correctly positioned and of appropriate length, to avoid possible kinking/obstruction
Demonstrates good  haemostatic technique, appropriate DC cardioversion if required and safe weaning from CPB including a TOE evaluation post CPB
Demonstrates appropriate use of epicardial pacing wires and closes the sternotomy and wound efficiently and appropriately
Constructs a clear operation note including post-operative instructions
Gives clear and concise handover to the ICU team and explains operative and post-operative process to the relatives

choices.text: Level0 - Not observed: Insufficient evidence observed to support a summary judgement
Level1 - Unable to perform: Unable to perform the procedure or part observed, under supervision
Level2 - Perform with supervision: Able to perform the procedure, or part observed, under supervision
Level3 - Minimal supervision: Able to perform the procedure with minimum supervision (needed occasional help)
Level4 - Competent: Competent to perform the procedure unsupervised (could deal with complications that arose)
